messages.subject: Re: Saskatoon Pie Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] outwitting those wily  toddlers
messages.msgSnippet: ... They are more like a black currant. The bushes can get 20 ft tall ... I m not kidding! They taste like a cross between a black currant and a blueberry.
messages.messageBody:
Laura M wrote:
>
> Hi Buzz,
> What are serive berries? I am from NJ and have never heard of these. Are
> they like blueberries? They grow on bushes in NJ.
> Laura

They are more like a black currant. The bushes can get 20 ft tall ...
I'm not kidding!
They taste like a cross between a black currant and a blueberry. They
are rather pithy and need to be softened first for pies and cobblers
etc.

They can get as large as the end of your thumb or be quite small like a
currant.

Buzz
